    • Method Detail

      • openUcdFileFromSystemExplorer

        public void openUcdFileFromSystemExplorer​(MainDisplay main)
        Allows a .ucd to be opened from a "popup" that ask tu user to choose a File. Only .ucd file will be considered because a filter is used to black othe type of files.
        Parameters:
        main - the mainDisplay on which to display the current model

      • createCsvFile

        public java.io.File createCsvFile​(java.lang.String fileName,
                                  java.util.Collection<? extends CsvFormatter> elements)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Entry point for the creation of the csv file from a Collection of elements that can be transformed into a csv element.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the file to save
        elements - This is the collections of element that will be saved in the csv file. Each element will be representedas a row in the csv file
        Returns:
        the file that represent the location on disk where the csv file was created
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • createUcdFileFromJavaClass

        public static java.io.File createUcdFileFromJavaClass​(java.lang.String path)
                                               throws java.io.IOException
        used to create a ucd file based on the content of the java files of the current project. Should only be used when a new .ucd file is required. Main.CREATE_SELF_UCD is used to control if this method is executed or not. It will generate all CLASS tag automatically then append manual.txt (provided it is in the same folder) content to the created file.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to where the new file will be saved. Also where manual.txt needs to be.
        Returns:
        the file that represent the location on disk where the ucd file was created
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • countLines

        public FileController.LineCount countLines​(java.nio.file.Path path)
                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Counts NLOC and CLOC of a file
        Parameters:
        path - path of the file to count the lines
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if someting happends during file opening
